Authors:
K. P. Deepna Latha, K. N. Anil Raj, V. Adnaan Farook,
Shahina Amabalath Sharafudheen, Neeraja K Parambil, Patinjareveettil
Manimohan
Title:
Three new species of Russulaceae from India based on
morphology and molecular phylogeny
Keywords:
Russulales, Basidiomycota, Lactifluus, Lactarius,
phylogeny, taxonomy
Abstract:
Three new species of Russulaceae, Lactifluus umbonatus and
Lacti. indicus belonging to subgenus Gerardii and Lactarius keralensis
belonging to subgenus Piperites, are described from Kerala State, India.
Comprehensive descriptions, photographs, line drawings and comparisons
with phenetically similar and phylogenetically related species are
discussed. Nuclear ribosomal internal transcribed spacer regions (ITS)
of the three species were sequenced and analyzed. In addition, nuclear
ribosomal large subunit (nLSU) gene of Lactifluus indicus was sequenced
and used in BLASTn search to find similar sequences. Maximum likelihood
(ML) analysis based on the ITS sequences confirmed both the novelty of
these species and their placement within their respective genera. The
discovery of Lactifluus umbonatus and Lacti. indicus represent the first
report of novel species belonging to subgenus Gerardii from India.
Lactifluus indicus represents the second record of a pleurotoid
Lactifluus species from India.
